channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street Lamp is not working for long time., 10th November
item.description:
Asset number 79B46A street lamp is not working since last year. I have came up with the same issue earlier last year, however problem has not solved yet. Kindly please help us to fix this matter as earlier possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Beaconsfield Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of rubbish dumped in the passageway off Chinbrook Road., 10th November
item.description:
Bags of rubbish dumped at the entrance to and also down in the passageway / alleyway. All of this rubbish can be seen from Chinbrook Road. Please can all if this rubbish be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chinbrook Road, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotten tree stuck stump , loose , all over the pavement , mud everywhere, 10th November
item.description:
I reported this back in July and nothing has been done about it , it is so dangerous , the residents simply have no regard for pedestrians , it’s now worse , thr stump is completely loose , the rotten wood and mud are all over the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped unwanted items Hackney Council hasn't cleaned this area up properly only done a small proportion. Glass everywhere over the floor very dangerous for animals and small children and families in area on family days out. Hackney Council stop being lazy and clean this mess up. It is not fixed until you clean it up., 9th November
item.description:
Dumped on wanted items.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastway, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mallard close pathway blocked with fly tipped rubbish items. Overgrown bushes and weeds. Health and safety fire assessment needed. Unwanted items discarded dumped., 9th November
item.description:
Mallard close pathway blocked with fly tipped rubbish items. Overgrown bushes and weeds. Health and safety fire assessment needed. Unwanted items discarded dumped. Lack of maintenance and inspection.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brinkworth Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Six-year-old girl, she was hit by an electric bike, she has a closed tib/fib fracture." The little girl they are talking about is Frida. She was out playing with friends in the park at the weekend when she was hit by someone on an electric bike. It fell on her, breaking her tibia and fibula – bones in her lower leg. Your hackney council only care about investment and money from these anti-social behavior line bikes. Is bikes are wrecking people's lives and causing injuries., 9th November
item.description:
Line bikes causing antisocial behavior,injuries to minors. Hackney Council get your act together and address issue of line bike nuisance, antisocial behavior causing harm to pedestrians public spaces, parks where children play.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic bollard needs cementing in securely, 9th November
item.description:
I reported this outside 182 Rowle Avenue and it's been marked as fixed now. But it hasn't been fixed. It is in the ground upright but not secure and keeps falling over. Please can someone investigate properly to ensure it's cemented back in properly. I can only think that the wrong bollard has previously been looked at. I have reported this several.times now and it's not been fixed. It's dangerous especially as this bollard sometimes gets knocked into the road and that is a hazard too

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180, Rowley Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street light working and very dark., 9th November
item.description:
No street light working and very dark. New lamp post installed but not working. Old lamp post not working and leaning at a dangerous angle. Precise address is at the corner of Dulwich Wood Avenue and Rusholme Grove, SE19 1 HF.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Wood Avenue, London

item.title: Waste all over Craig’s Court, 9th November
item.description:
Bike blocking fire exit at the back of Silver Cross bags cardboard and other rubbish next to bins, feces urine and crushed glass on the pavement and the road- why is it acceptable to tolerate this blatant abuse of public space ? can the council please remove St cleaners bins from here and require businesses to keep their waste inside their premises till just before collection instead of dumping it for days to come !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-5, Great Scotland Yard, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste in Craig's Court blocking fire exits, 9th November
item.description:
Waste blocking fire exit between BT exchange and great Scotland Yard Hotel - reported weeks ago - still there... bottles and other rubbish on the fire escape stairs at the back of hotel -and old shades pub. drugs paraphernalia urine feces in between bins - why is this tolerated for so long !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-5, Great Scotland Yard, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
